chapterMetadata.title: Metals and Non-metals
chapterMetadata.subject: Science
learningObjectives: Classify elements as metals and non-metals
Understand physical and chemical properties of metals and non-metals
Learn about metal reactivity and extraction
Understand the concept of reactivity series
Learn methods of metal extraction and refining
prerequisites: Basic understanding of elements from Class IX

ncertComputationalThinking.problemSolvingApproach: Systematic investigation of metal properties and reactions

sections.title: Physical Properties of Metals and Non-metals
sections.summary: Detailed exploration of physical characteristics distinguishing metals and non-metals

keyConcepts.name: Metallic Lustre
keyConcepts.description: Metals have a shining surface when pure

keyConcepts.name: Malleability
keyConcepts.description: Ability of metals to be beaten into thin sheets
examples: Gold can be beaten into extremely thin sheets

keyConcepts.name: Ductility
keyConcepts.description: Ability of metals to be drawn into thin wires
examples: A wire of 2 km length can be drawn from one gram of gold

keyConcepts.name: Conductivity
keyConcepts.description: Metals are good conductors of heat and electricity
details: Silver and copper are best heat conductors

activities.title: Metal Properties Investigation
activities.description: Conduct experiments to test metallic properties like lustre, malleability, and ductility

examples.content: Gold and silver are the most malleable metals

exercises.question: Compare the properties of different metal samples

sections.title: Chemical Properties of Metals
sections.summary: Comprehensive investigation of metal reactions with various substances

keyConcepts.name: Metal Oxides
keyConcepts.description: Metals combine with oxygen to form basic oxides
variations: Some metals like aluminium form amphoteric oxides

keyConcepts.name: Reactivity Series
keyConcepts.description: Metals arranged in order of decreasing reactivity
details: Helps predict metal behavior in chemical reactions
Ranges from most reactive (potassium) to least reactive (gold)

activities.title: Reaction of Metals with Oxygen
activities.description: Observe how different metals react when burned in air

activities.title: Metals and Water Reaction
activities.description: Investigate how metals react with cold and hot water

sections.title: Extraction of Metals
sections.summary: Comprehensive study of metal extraction techniques based on reactivity

keyConcepts.name: Metallurgy
keyConcepts.description: Process of extracting metals from their ores

keyConcepts.name: Enrichment of Ores
keyConcepts.description: Removing impurities from metal ores before extraction

examples.content: Metals at the bottom of the activity series are found in free state

keyVocabulary.definition: The process of extracting metals from their ores
List of metals arranged in order of their decreasing reactivity
Metal oxide that can react with both acids and bases

commonMisconceptions.misconception: All metals have the same properties
commonMisconceptions.correction: Metals have varying properties based on their reactivity and composition
Electrical conductivity varies between different metals

assessmentIdeas.description: Identify metals through their characteristic reactions
Predict metal reactions based on reactivity series

practicalApplications.description: Industrial processes for obtaining pure metals
Creating materials with improved properties by mixing metals

crossCurricularConnections.subject: Physics
crossCurricularConnections.integration: Understanding how metal properties relate to electrical conduction

crossCurricularConnections.subject: History
crossCurricularConnections.integration: Role of metallurgy in human civilization

mediaProduction: Create digital presentations on metal properties
